sen.j: 藤原 師家（ふじわら の もろいえ、万寿4年（1027年） - 康平元年9月3日 (旧暦)（1058年9月29日））は平安時代後期の官人。
sen.e: Born in 1027 and gone on September 29, 1058, "FUJIWARA no Moroie" was a middle-ranking Court noble in the later Heian period.

sen.e: When at the position of "Ushoben" (Minor Controller of the Right), Moroie passed by the house in which his former girlfriend lived, and her family called him to drop in, so he returned his ox-drawn carriage and entered her house.

sen.j: すると、その女の様子がことのほか素晴らしかったので、師家は女を捨ててしまったことを後悔して弁解したものの、女はひたすら読経するばかりで、返事もしない有様であった。
sen.e: And, finding her looks unexpectedly beautiful, Moroie regretted his abandoning her and excused himself, but she just chanted sutras and made no reply.

sen.j: 女は経典を唱える内に、法華経七巻の「即往安楽世界」というくだりを繰り返し誦んでいたところ、そのまま気を失ってしまう。
sen.e: While she chanted sutras, she came to a passage in Vol. 7 of "Hoke-kyo Sutra" (the Lotus Sutra), which says that (after one's death) one can soon go to heaven, and when she repeated the passage, she fainted.

sen.e: Though her families & Moroie took care of her, she died before long.

sen.e: Grieving for her death, Moroie secluded himself in a mountain village, so he was rumored to become a recluse.
